programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Former Spice Girl Geri Horner joins host Matt Tebbutt to sample dishes prepared in the studio kitchen by Ghanaian food specialist Zoe Adjonyoh and chef Theo Randall.(n)

programme.title: Trooping the Colour
programme.desc: Coverage of the annual pageant, which officially marks the birthday of HM Queen Elizabeth II, performed by the 1st Battalion Irish Guards on Horse Guards Parade.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Bislett Games. Gabby Logan presents highlights from Oslo of the fifth round of the season, staged at the Bislett Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Warrington Wolves v Wigan Warriors (Kick-off 3.00pm). Coverage of the third quarter-final, which takes place between the Super League sides at the Halliwell Jones Stadium. The Wolves were edged out in a thrilling final last year by Hull FC, and predicting the outcome of this match is difficult, given both clubs' inconsistent form in the league.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts as more famous faces settle into the black chair, with the opening edition seeing chef Paul Rankin, TV presenter Sonali Shah, comedian Omid Djalili and CBBC's Hacker T Dog answering questions on the specialist subjects of Stieg Larsson's Millennium trilogy, the human body, Chelsea FC, and Pet Shop Boys. The second round sees them putting their general knowledge to the test in a bid to carry off the commemorative trophy.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts an edition based on the subject of music, as Sinitta, Jaymi Hensley, Vernie Bennett, Easther Bennett, Claire Richards, Ian 'H' Watkins, Tony Christie and Ben Adams try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Richard Osman is the man with the answers.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord finally gets a chance to find out whether he really is Scottish, or just cross, as he and Bill visit ancient Aberdeenshire. Their mission: to solve the mystery of what happened to the Ninth Legion of the Roman army, which vanished from records after marching beyond Hadrian's Wall and into the mists of Scotland during the second century. Bill has cooked up a theory about the fate that befell the missing soldiers, but what she discovers is far more dangerous - a cairn on a hillside containing a doorway to the end of the world. Sci-fi drama, starring Peter Capaldi, Pearl Mackie and Matt Lucas.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: New series. Mel Giedroyc presents the choral music contest, in which choirs of all sizes, genres and voices compete in a series of head-to-head knock-out challenges. First, each group is given a chance to display their speciality with a `showstopper' performance, before battling it out with their rivals in a themed `riff-off'. The winning group will be decided by a panel of experts, including crusading choirmaster Gareth Malone, former choir-girl Kelis, and this week's guest judge Will Young.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.sub-title: Do Not Stand at My Grave and Weep.
programme.desc: The day of Cal's funeral arrives, and when details emerge of how his brother spent his final moments, a troubled Ethan turns to drink. Meanwhile, a school trip to France comes to an abrupt end when a scuffle on board the coach causes it to crash. As a result, the ED is inundated with teenage patients, including Sean, whose unusual vitamin tablets ring alarm-bells for the staff, and Sky, whose mother is a long-term advocate of alternative medicine, and is not happy about her daughter receiving an X-ray scan.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is upset that Trevor has decided to work for a mission project in Africa, and resolves to give him an unforgettable send-off to remind him of the loving family he has in Ireland. Cathy's family counselling session descends into chaos, Buster and Dermot land themselves in trouble because of a circus lion, and neighbour Winnie is delighted that her husband's libido has returned. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Shanghai Knights
programme.desc: Chinese sheriff Chon Wang and reformed bandit Roy O'Bannon head for Victorian London on the trail of a murderer. Their investigation leads them to a nefarious Englishman plotting to kill the royal family - but fortunately Chon's talented sister comes to their aid. Martial arts comedy sequel, with Jackie Chan, Owen Wilson, Aidan Gillen and Fann Wong.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: New series. Topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with new presenters Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett introducing guest panellists and viewers' contributions.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Wonnacott invites two teams to scour Westpoint Antiques Fair outside Exeter, Devon for bargains to sell for profit at auction. Advice is provided by Philip Serrell and Caroline Hawley.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a basement flat in East Dulwich, south London, and properties in Ebbw Vale, Blaenau Gwent and Workington, Cumbria. They then speak to the new owners about their plans for the buildings, and find out how much they paid for them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and the team reclaim items from a recycling centre in Bredbury, Greater Manchester, with Guy Trench aiming to turn a rusty petrol can into a lighting fixture.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Elizabeth Talbot finds an early gramophone among the antiques at Stapleford Park in Leicestershire, while Mark Stacey reveals a fondness for big cats. Meanwhile, Paul Martin visits Thrumpton Hall in Nottinghamshire to examine its opulent Restoration staircase, and discovers a connection with Lord Byron through some interesting relics.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple looking for a property in rural Cheshire, and also visits the Anderson Boat Lift, which links the River Weaver and the Trent and Mersey Canal.(n)

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Tom Hollander presents an appeal on behalf of IntoUniversity, a charity that provides local learning centres in some of the UK's most deprived communities.(n)

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Connie Fisher joins the Street Angels of Magaluf as they patrol the Spanish party town, offering aid and advice to dusk-to-dawn revellers.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin face one of their biggest challenges yet as they try to help the Caan family from Glasgow, showing them simple and effective ways to save money on their weekly food shop. Dad, Ryan is addicted to food shopping and loves to have a fridge bursting with food, while for convenience the family often opt for takeaways throughout the week too, sending their food bills spiraling out of control. Can Gregg and Chris get them cooking from scratch and ditch the takeaways?.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Sean Fletcher present the show from the Hay Festival, where they meet the event's organisers as well as writers and artists. Ellie also goes on a wildlife safari inspired by one of the featured books and joins a team spotting and tracking adders with radio transmitters. Plus, Adam Henson reports on technology for preventing droughts and John Craven presents an update on the Countryfile Photographic Competition.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce returns to BBC Caversham, near Reading, where objects brought in to be valued include a communion book that was originally owned by war poet Wilfred Owen, an Aston Martin sports car, and a finely embroidered 17th-century needlework box that creates a surprise when its value is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Verity anxiously awaits word of her husband, who is sailing for Lisbon, when news reaches Trenwith of a naval battle in which both he and Dwight may have been killed. Ross is reunited with a disreputable old friend of his father, who tells him that Dwight has been captured and is facing execution in France - prompting him to turn down the position of magistrate and sail to the rescue. Drake proposes to Sam that the Methodists can worship at the church, but the decision angers George, who has them driven from the building.(n)

programme.title: Thor: The Dark World
programme.desc: The alien thunder god returns to Earth when a powerful weapon from the dawn of time is discovered. The device attracts the attention of an old enemy of his people, who intends to use it to plunge the universe into darkness - and to stop him, Thor must form an uneasy alliance with his treacherous brother Loki. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tom Hiddleston and Natalie Portman.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: In Name Only
programme.desc: Wealthy socialite Alec Walker falls for widow Julie Eden - but reckons without his own ruthless wife's attempts to derail the new romance by refusing him a divorce. Marital drama, starring Cary Grant, Carole Lombard, Kay Francis, Charles Coburn and Helen Vinson.(n)

programme.title: Wonder Man
programme.desc: Nightclub entertainer Buzzy Bellew witnesses a murder committed by gangster Ten Grand Jackson and is killed by two of his thugs. Buzzy comes back as a ghost and tries to persuade his bookish twin Edwin Dingle to avenge his death by helping the police catch Jackson. Comedy musical, starring Danny Kaye, Virginia Mayo, Vera-Ellen, Donald Woods and Steve Cochran.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: Monty Halls returns to his roots as a marine biologist, setting up home for the summer in the fishing village of Roundstone on the west coast of Ireland. Whales, dolphins, porpoises and sharks can be found in the waters off Connemara during their migrations, and Monty's task is to collect information on the numbers passing through the area before the winter storms arrive.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The first of the Central region heats sees returning contender Pip Lacey and newcomers Ryan Simpson and Nick Deverell-Smith preparing their starters. They must impress a Great British Menu veteran if they are to cook for the judges in the regional final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Central region chefs fight it out for the fish course, with Pip Lacey combining lobster with strawberry in tribute to the classic Wimbledon strawberries and cream. Ryan Simpson also uses lobster in his recreation of a barbecue and has invented a special technique to create his unique chips, while Nick Deverell-Smith focuses on crab to make a savoury cream tea.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Cooks
programme.desc: The food writer and Great British Bake Off judge gives step-by-step instructions for recipes to impress guests at dinner parties, preparing two varieties of canapes, a salmon and asparagus starter, a main course of guinea fowl, and a chocolate tart for pudding. Mary also reveals a trick for cooking steak ahead of time that guarantees perfect results.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A semi-detached bungalow in Huthwaite, Nottinghamshire, a one-bedroom 1950s flat in London's Wandsworth and a former shop complete with three flats in Delabole, Cornwall are all sold at auction. Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners to hear about their plans for the properties, before cameras return to see how they have got on.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In a special one-hour edition of the show, Caroline Hawley and Colin Young each help two teams search for potentially profitable items at an antiques fair in Builth Wells, Powys. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott reports on a rare book he finds at the event, and visits the V&A Museum of Childhood in east London.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A profile of the movie actor, who died in September 2008. Newman won an Academy Award for his performance in the 1986 Martin Scorsese-directed film The Color of Money, and was nominated eight further times in his career. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
programme.desc: A dying plantation owner summons his two sons to put his estate in order. The older of the pair, a washed-up American football player with a drinking problem, is tormented by the death of a friend and resents his loyally supportive wife, and is forced by the reunion to come to terms with his personal demons. Drama based on Tennessee Williams' stage play, starring Paul Newman, Elizabeth Taylor and Burl Ives.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Charles Hanson are in Margam Country Park near Port Talbot to value items, while Paul Martin visits Cardiff Castle to see furniture by William Burges.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The second of two programmes sees Michael Portillo continue his journey through the Netherlands. Along the way, the political pundit roots around the world's largest flower auction in Haarlem and investigates Amsterdam's famous red light district. In Haarlem, Michael sees how 21 million stems and two million potted plants are auctioned every day from a vast complex roughly the size of Monaco. Arriving in Utrecht, the presenter observes the main hub of the Dutch railway network and its busiest station, discovering that the first constitution of the Netherlands was signed here.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme celebrates its 50th anniversary at Gardeners' World Live at Birmingham's NEC. Joe Swift and Adam Frost explore the show gardens and meet a designer who has created a garden showcasing 50 years of changing trends. Carol Klein looks at the plants that have defined the decades, while Rachel de Thame, Flo Headlam, Alan Power, Nick Bailey and Mark Lane explore other features of the event. Main host Monty Don catches up with predecessor Alan Titchmarsh to discuss the series, while Mary Berry reveals the winner of the golden jubilee plant award.(n)

programme.title: Trooping the Colour
programme.desc: Another chance to see highlights from the annual ceremony, in which the 1st Battalion Irish Guards marked the birthday of HM Queen Elizabeth II on Horse Guards Parade.(n)

programme.title: Live International Rugby Union
programme.desc: Argentina v England (Kick-off 8.15pm). Jason Mohammad presents coverage of the concluding match of the two-Test series, staged at the Estadio Brigadier General Estanislao Lopez, Santa Fe. While England are shorn of several players representing the British & Irish Lions in New Zealand, Eddie Jones has been able to select a squad with a fine balance of experience and youth for this challenging tour against the Pumas. With analysis by Brian Moore, Ugo Monye and Jeremy Guscott.(n)

programme.title: Kevin Bridges: A Whole Different Story
programme.desc: The comedian on stage at Glasgow's SSE Hydro during his 2015 stand-up tour. He entertains 12,000 fans with his thoughts on economic theory, art history and diet tips, as well as politics and the Scottish referendum. He also deals with the rigours of growing up and adapting to his new-found place in the world - coupled with the added novelty of having money for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Blood is spilt as the sumptuous period drama reaches its penultimate episode. Realising he is less than God-like, Louis XIV receives advice from pious Madame Scarron - but can the king truly humble himself? Desperate Madame de Montespan is persuaded a dark ritual will reverse her fall from grace. Ordered to initiate intimacy with traitorous Thomas, Philippe finds himself forced to mask the motive from Chevalier to prevent an expected brutal response. George Blagden, Catherine Walker, Anna Brewster, Mark Rendall, Alexander Vlahos and Evan Williams star.(n)

programme.title: Cafe de Flore
programme.desc: In 1969, a single mother raises a son with Down's syndrome. When she is told he is unlikely to live past 25, she resolves to make his short life as happy as possible. In 2011, a famous DJ's happy family life is threatened by his troubled ex-wife. Gradually, a connection between the two stories emerges. Drama, with Vanessa Paradis and Kevin Parent. In French.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter Q, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and designer Danny Clarke have just one day to transform a grey and windswept roof terrace in Basingstoke into a cosy and colourful outdoor room for owner Aimee.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme celebrates its 50th anniversary at Gardeners' World Live at Birmingham's NEC. Joe Swift and Adam Frost explore the show gardens and meet a designer who has created a garden showcasing 50 years of changing trends. Carol Klein looks at the plants that have defined the decades, while Rachel de Thame, Flo Headlam, Alan Power, Nick Bailey and Mark Lane explore other features of the event. Main host Monty Don catches up with predecessor Alan Titchmarsh to discuss the series, while Mary Berry reveals the winner of the golden jubilee plant award.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Jim McColl tries to find a way to grow tomatoes, peppers and cucumbers side by side in his domestic-size greenhouse - not an easy task with limited space. Carole Baxter and George Anderson get out their pruning saws to cut back the woodland garden, and Brian Cunningham visits the meticulous Pitmedden Gardens in Aberdeenshire to find out how head gardener Susan Burgess tackles the problem of Box Blight with the six miles of clipped box hedging of which she is in charge.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The rural current affairs series visits Northern Ireland, where Joe Crowley heads into the woods near Belfast to help members of the RSPB tag swifts. He also tours a farm where physalis, mustard flowers and Asian radishes are found growing alongside the usual fare of potatoes, carrots and cauliflowers. Ellie Harrison takes in sites associated with St Patrick on Church Island, and Adam Henson finds out why herdwick sheep are being used to graze on ground where some of the UK's rarest plants are found.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing the Central regions, Pip Lacey, Ryan Simpson and Nick Deverell-Smith, go all out to impress with their main courses. Ryan hopes to elevate a ploughman's lunch into a banquet-worthy dish, while Pip pays tribute to an unusual Wimbledon icon, and Nick celebrates venison in his main course.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Central chefs - Pip Lacey, Nick Deverell-Smith and Ryan Simpson - prepare their desserts, knowing this is the last chance to impress before one of them has to leave the competition. Two of them use pineapple, in reference to the fruit on top of the Wimbledon men's singles trophy, while the third celebrates the summer ice-cream van. Which two will make it through to tomorrow?.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining central region chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Jordanne Whiley - who with Yui Kamiji is the current Wimbledon wheelchair doubles holder - as the programme continues its tennis-themed series.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives, focusing on items suitable for picnics, including Paul Hollywood's quail's egg pork pies.(n)

programme.title: Sailing
programme.desc: Shirley Robertson presents action from races one and two of the prestigious event in Bermuda, as Oracle Team USA look to triumph for the third successive occasion.(n)

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Hull FC v Castleford Tigers (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Chapman presents coverage of the concluding quarter-final, which takes place at the KCOM Stadium. The hosts are the defending champions after their dramatic victory in last year's final against Warrington Wolves, but they start as underdogs against the Tigers, who have been the outstanding side in this season's Super League.(n)

programme.title: Rowing World Cup
programme.desc: Matthew Pinsent is joined by Katherine Grainger to present highlights of the latest regatta of the season from Poznan, Poland.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc: The concluding episode of the documentary about the construction of the Crossrail train line linking east and west London follows the work of engineers building 10 new stations. A team battles to put together the giant jigsaw that will become a cathedral-sized station at Canary Wharf. The structure is so big it has to be erected underwater in a dock, while the roof comes in a kit of more than 2,500 pieces. As the underground caverns that will become the new stations are carved out, workers uncover gruesome reminders of the city's past.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A merchant navy officer-turned-product designer demonstrates his tablet holder, while two proud parents pitch their organic skincare product for babies. A young entrepreneur hopes to impress with his activity monitor for pets, but will the Dragons see the potential in his innovative product, or will he be left in the dog house? Presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A nurse living in Nottingham whose husband is in the army has rarely settled for long in one place and would like to move somewhere with a sense of community. She trades places with a B&B owner from Alaska, who is hoping to escape her small-town life and see more of the world as she approaches retirement.(n)

programme.title: Theresa v Boris: The Battle to be PM
programme.desc: Docu-drama telling the story of the Conservative Party's 2016 leadership campaign, from the day David Cameron resigned to the day Theresa May became Prime Minister. Based on exhaustive research and first-person testimonies, this dramatised narrative goes beyond the headlines to lay bare the politicking and positioning, betrayals and blunders of this extraordinary political time. The programme also features key interviews with people who were intimately involved in the campaigns of the main contenders.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Zoe Lyons. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: Vincent is nominated for Entrepreneur of the Year in the Essex Business Awards and immediately splashes out a table for the company. But first he must face his wife, who confronts him about rumours she heard linking him and their son's primary school teacher. Meanwhile, Vincent and Lavender discover that Fitzpatrick is a CB radio enthusiast, and cannot resist going undercover to dupe him.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: Pakistan v India. Action from the final at The Oval in south London, which provided the setting for the climax of the eighth staging of the tournament.(n)

programme.title: Nicola Benedetti's Indian Serenade
programme.desc: Documentary following the violinist as she joins the Scottish Symphony Orchestra on a tour of India, going behind the scenes with her as she plays in Mumbai and New Delhi and experiences the country for the very first time. Nicola also takes part in workshops for local children and gives an informal performance to pupils at a Mumbai municipal school.(n)

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World 2017
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny and American soprano Angel Blue are in Cardiff to host the first of this year's two grand finals. Today, the winner of the Song Prize will be announced, which sees the five most successful entrants performing an intimate `Art Song' or Lieder to the panel of expert judges. This time, instead of being supported by an orchestra, accompaniment will come in the form of a single piano, and on hand to discuss the performances are celebrated lyric tenor John Mark Ainsley and leading vocal coach Mary King.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: The discovery of Woody Baldwin's body gives Cardinal and Delorme a chance to connect the murders to Eric Fraser, and the race to catch him before he kills Keith.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: John wonders whether there is still something he and Delorme are missing, and a trip to the pharmacy where Edie works uncovers a disturbing piece of evidence.(n)

programme.title: Lemmy: The Movie
programme.desc: Documentary charting the life of the Motorhead frontman, following him on various tours over the course of three years. The film examines his rise to fame in the 1970s and the influence of the band's distinctive sound on punk and heavy metal groups. With contributions by Alice Cooper, Dave Grohl, Peter Hook, Jarvis Cocker, Mick Jones and Metallica's James Hetfield and Robert Trujillo.(n)

programme.title: Lemmy: In His Own Words
programme.desc: Documentary, making use of archive interviews with Ian Fraser Kilmister, AKA Motorhead frontman Lemmy, to highlight his pioneering influence on the hard rock and heavy metal genres.(n)

programme.title: Heavy Metal Britannia
programme.desc: Documentary tracing the genre's emergence in the late 1960s, pioneered by bands including Black Sabbath and Judas Priest, who were based in the industrialised Midlands. This classic form of metal was challenged by punk in the late 1970s, before a new wave of groups such as Iron Maiden, Def Leppard and Saxon reinvigorated the style. Featuring contributions by singers Ian Gillan, Glenn Tipton, Lemmy, Bruce Dickinson and Rob Halford, guitarist Tony Iommi and keyboard player Jon Lord. Narrated by Nigel Planer.(n)

programme.title: David Bowie and the Story of Ziggy Stardust
programme.desc: Jarvis Cocker narrates an insight into the singer-songwriter's creation of his glam-rock alter ego, revealing how his hairstyles, fashion sense, stage presentation and album The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars turned him into a star. Featuring contributions by Elton John, Marc Almond, Holly Johnson, Peter Hook and Jon Savage.(n)

programme.title: Lemmy: In His Own Words
programme.desc: Documentary, making use of archive interviews with Ian Fraser Kilmister, AKA Motorhead frontman Lemmy, to highlight his pioneering influence on the hard rock and heavy metal genres.(n)

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.sub-title: Secret Knowledge: Nina Simone & Me with Laura Mvula.
programme.desc: The soul singer travels to New York City to explore the songs made famous by Simone that mean the most to her, and trace the late singer's musical roots with the help of those who knew the `High Priestess of Soul'. Laura reveals the influence of Nina's classical training, meets Simone's long-time guitarist Al Shackman and performs with a Harlem gospel choir as she pays tribute to the genius of her musical heroine.(n)

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World 2017
programme.sub-title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World 2017 Final.
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny and Angel Blue present the final of the opera singing contest live from St David's Hall, joined by soprano Danielle de Niese and baritone Gerald Finley. The five remaining singers perform, accompanied by the BBC National Orchestra of Wales, before the event's patron Kiri te Kanawa announces the winner. Subsequent programmes are subject to change.(n)

programme.title: Doris Day: Virgin Territory
programme.desc: A profile of the American singer, actress and animal rights activist, featuring contributions by James Garner, Richard Carpenter, Terence Davies and Don Pippin. The programme delves into the troubled private life and career highs and lows of the star of such films as Pillow Talk, Calamity Jane, That Touch of Mink, The Thrill of It All and Caprice. Narrated by Michael Brandon.(n)

programme.title: Buddy Holly: Rave On
programme.desc: Rock 'n' roll started with Elvis, but some believe that pop music started with Buddy Holly and the Crickets. As a songwriter, Holly revolutionised the genre by introducing dynamic new rhythms and unpredictable melodies beyond its traditional blues roots. In his songs written and recorded in the late '50s, it is already possible to hear the beat group sound of the 1960s, and beyond. This documentary tells the story of Holly's tragically short life and career through interviews with those who knew him and worked with him. Contributors include Don McLean, Paul Anka, Don Everly, Hank Marvin and Bob Harris.(n)

programme.desc: Frank blithely starts helping himself to the snacks on sale in a local supermarket - much to the anger of the manager, who wastes no time in confronting him. Comedy, starring Peter Boyle, with Jeff Garlin.(n)

programme.title: Frasier

programme.desc: The guys invite the girls to a Dungeons & Dragons night when their trip to Vegas falls through after an incident with airport security. However, following a few drinks, Sheldon and Amy's relationship takes an unexpected turn. Meanwhile, Raj goes on a date with Lucy, who tries to sneak out of the restaurant's bathroom window - but ends up getting stuck and calling for his help.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is offered an exciting job opportunity, but it will mean he has to leave the country for several months. Penny tries to support his ambitions, while Sheldon is jealous and attempts to discourage him from accepting the post. Meanwhile, Raj pushes the boundaries with Lucy, but puts their relationship in jeopardy.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny struggles with Leonard's confession that he kissed another woman when he was away on his North Sea research expedition. After driving all the way to Las Vegas, she must now decide whether she wants to go through with the wedding. Back home, Sheldon doesn't know how to act after Amy tells him she wants them to take a relationship break.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Hard-hearted Mr Burns decides to deny his employees any more free medication, prompting Homer to whisk Grampa away on a drug-smuggling mission to Canada. Unfortunately, the duo fall foul of the authorities on their return journey.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart attends a rock concert with Milhouse, so Marge and Homer buy him a guitar to encourage his musical interests - but it is Otto who ends up calling the tune. Featuring the voices of Spinal Tap members Michael McKean and Christopher Guest.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse falls in love with a new girl at school and begins to spend all his time with her, so, in a bid to get his friend back, Bart decides to tell her strict Catholic father about the relationship.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Bell House Hotel in Wiltshire, where business partners Chris Williams and Jacqui Hogg hope guests will appreciate their attempts to bring London chic to the shires. Susan and David Speak are frustrated by the low shower pressure, while Jade Hendon butts heads with Matthew over healthy eating at dinner and the hosts' absence at breakfast the next morning gets the criticism flowing.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Partridge in Oxfordshire, where young couple Matthew Cockman and Paula Szkwarkowska hope guests will get on board with their passion for local organic food. A communal bathroom has the guests lost for words, and the lack of a hot breakfast included in the price leaves a bad taste in everyone's mouths.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Strawberry Gardens B&B in Heysham for the third day of the contest, where husband and wife team Susan and David Speak offer home-from-home accommodation and an abundance of northern hospitality. Sports enthusiast David treats his guests to a traditional darts competition, adjudicated by former world champion Alan Warriner-Little, but he is unimpressed when Paula sends back her evening meal. However, it is Chris and Jacqui's feedback that disappoints the hosts the most.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Bateman's Mill near Chesterfield, where manager Jade Hendon has high hopes of being the best. But she faces an uphill battle when David and Susan go out of their way to find hairs in the bathroom - and to make mattters worse, her Derbyshire breakfast is not a hit with Chris and Jacqui.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores, starting with Chris and Jacqui, owners of the Bell House, who want to find out why Matthew marked them down for being `too tall' for his bed. The group members proceed to thrash out their differences before the week's winners are revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Ever since Ted and Diane Brewer first met on holiday over 20 years ago, they've dreamed about having a place of their own in the sun. With retirement approaching and Ted's kids grown up, they now feel the time is right to take the plunge. Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £110,000 budget around the Mojacar area on Spain's Costa de Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Big House, Little House
programme.desc: Poppy and Pam in Portsmouth plan to spend £50,000 turning their empty loft into a work studio and en suite bedroom, while a couple in the West Midlands seek to extend their kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: The duo meet a couple of medics whose three-bedroom Victorian semi is no longer working for them and their two young daughters. GP Kathleen loves the location and reckons the house could be made to work but anaesthetist Tom prefers the idea of selling to pursue a better life in the country. Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer follow up each possibility, nursing the doctors to a unanimous decision as to whether they should stay or sell.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: New series. Award-winning designer Alan Gardner returns to transform another selection of suburban British gardens from unruly wastelands into horticultural masterpieces. He begins his latest campaign in Lancashire, where Pinky and Joe request help dealing with their oddly shaped triangular plot. Plus, Alan makes the first in a series of inspiration trips to America, beginning with a visit to an urban oasis in New York.(n)

programme.title: Iron Man 2
programme.desc: Tycoon-turned-superhero Tony Stark confronts a fearsome new foe in a Russian scientist using his own deadly hi-tech weapons to seek revenge. He also faces a struggle to keep his secrets out of the hands of both the government and an amoral rival, and discovers the armour he developed to fight evil is slowly killing him. Action adventure sequel, with Robert Downey Jr, Mickey Rourke and Don Cheadle. Edited for language and violence.(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner
programme.desc: Premiere. A teen arrives in an isolated community of youngsters, with no memory of who he is or the outside world. When another new arrival brings an ominous message, he realises time is running out for the group and they must find an escape route through a deadly labyrinth if they are to survive. Sci-fi adventure based on James Dashner's novel, starring Dylan O'Brien, Kaya Scodelario and Patricia Clarkson.(n)

programme.title: The Stone Roses: Made of Stone
programme.desc: Documentary about the influential British rock band, in which film-maker Shane Meadows follows the group as they prepare for their 2012 reunion concerts at Manchester's Heaton Park, the first time they had played together in 16 years. Featuring previously unseen archive footage spanning the Roses' history.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Omnibus. Tom is not ready to face his fears, Lily is scared that her scars from the crash may not heal, and Scott prepares for a fete for the MS awareness day he has organised. Meanwhile, Tony, Harry and Mercedes get a shock when they get home.(n)

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: Jordan finds himself in charge of a baby that he has to sneak into school, but it is harder to conceal than he first anticipated, so blackmails PE teacher Steve into helping him out. Unable to return it to its mother, a stumped Steve ends up taking Jordan and the baby back to his house. Meanwhile, Missy agrees that if Cory sleeps with Nas, she will sleep with Cory. However, she soon discovers Cory has a loose tongue and that the whole school now thinks this is an open opportunity.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond

programme.title: The Simpsons

Animated adventure, with the voices of Diego Luna, Zoe Saldana and Channing Tatum.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun

programme.desc: A single father with six children cannot afford to both feed his family and heat their home, while a man who was seriously injured in a car accident more than 10 years ago struggles to prove to the authorities that he is unable to work, and a woman setting up a fortune telling business faces an uncertain future.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Benefits Handout
programme.desc: Three long-term unemployed families on benefits are given a cash lump sum of £26,000 in return for signing off, to see if they have what it takes to improve their lives and escape the benefits trap. This opening episode introduces the three families, including Tony and Diane from Hull and their 21-year-old son Michael, who persuades his parents to let him buy the latest PlayStation. Scott and Leanne from Liverpool order some bouncy castles as they start a party business, while single mum Rachel treats her family and friends to an all-you-can-eat Chinese buffet.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: A mature student in Nottinghamshire suffered when the woman downstairs turned her flat into a 24/7 party house - yet worse was to come when it all went quiet. A Northampton cat-lover discovered a shocking secret in a neighbour's back garden after three of her beloved pets went missing, and a single dad's relations with a neighbour turned sour after a series of strange occurrences in Chiswick.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: Jessica's fresh start in Stockport was made easier by her next-door neighbour Daniel - until the arrival of an unexpected visitor revealed the truth about him. A doctor expected a few problems when she moved from the south of England to the north - but nothing could prepare her for the disruption caused by her neighbour's large extension, a redevelopment which took over her garden and, eventually, her life. Plus, the story of a man who was delighted when an old friend moved in next door - until he was accused of making a complaint about their driveway.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court Enforcement agents evict a large group of squatters barricaded into a disused nursery in London, and have to resort to smashing their way in as they refuse to leave. Meanwhile, agents in Bristol try to recover over £10,000 owed by a plumbing business to a supplier, and emotions run high when they attempt to evict a tenant who pleads her innocence in West London.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In South East London, officers Gary and Cona chase a debt of nearly £50,000 in unpaid rent, leading to a feisty confrontation with the debtor. Elsewhere, agents Gary and Paul try to recover over £2,000 owed by a teenager to a local garage in Kent, and officers Max and Paul head to South West London on the trail of a film producer who owes £8,000 to financial advisers.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.desc: Iain Lee narrates a selection of zany online clips featuring cats demonstrating their now-renowned capacity for mischief. Dave Spikey, Matt Richardson and Andi Osho are on hand to help highlight the feline fails.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: New series. Paul O'Grady hosts a revival of the dating show in which contestants must choose between three unseen suitors based on their answers to a series of questions. The first episode sees a woman from Southport and a man with an eight-inch beard asking the questions, while cameras also follow two strangers from different backgrounds on a blind date in Barcelona.(n)

programme.title: Before They Were Stars
programme.desc: Dale Winton treks back through the TV archive to uncover embarrassing early brushes with fame endured by some of today's biggest stars. Among those skewered are pop stars, rock legends, silver-screen icons, celebrated comedians and sporting heroes.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing the housemates' reactions to the second eviction, as well as the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs and diary room visits. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Comedy Store
programme.sub-title: Michael McIntyre: Live at the Comedy Store.
programme.desc: The comedian performs at the famous Soho comedy club, discussing topics including shopping, politics, what Brits call extreme weather, Scottish money and pregnancy tests.(n)

programme.title: The Story of
programme.desc: Documentary about the comedian's rise to fame, examining the influence of his fellow comedian father on his early routines before his eventual breakthrough performance at the 2006 Royal Variety show. The programme also explores how he has been involved in series that have reinvented stand-up comedy on TV, including Live at the Apollo and Comedy Roadshow.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Bad Lieutenant: Port of Call New Orleans
programme.desc: A cop injures his back while saving a prisoner during Hurricane Katrina, earning himself a promotion but leaving him hopelessly addicted to painkillers and cocaine. As he investigates the drug-related murder of a family, he begins suffering strange hallucinations. Werner Herzog's drama, with Nicolas Cage, Eva Mendes and Val Kilmer.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice works her magic on an arty garden flat in the Kensal Green area of west London, where the owners are finding it difficult to attract a buyer.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Roary the Racing Car
programme.desc: Big Chris discovers a novel way of cleaning Roary's fuel intake.(n)

programme.title: Pip Ahoy
programme.desc: Alba finds a small but very rare snail while out looking for new scientific discoveries.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.desc: Children's animated series with the little wooden boy and his friend.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The curious primate learns to be a firefighter and prepares to tackle blazes.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Bop Box
programme.desc: Derek Moran, Jen Pringle and Olivia Birchenough race to the rescue as a police officer, paramedic and firefighter.(n)

programme.title: Mr Men
programme.desc: The colourful characters enjoy being out on the pond.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig takes Peppa and George to the playground, but has trouble understanding the children's rules.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig takes Peppa and George to a fish pond that he used to visit when he was a piglet.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Monty the meerkat wants to be a lookout for his colony, but he is hopeless at standing still.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: When the pups find a stowaway on their trip to the icy tundra, they must rescue a runaway kitty on a runaway snowcat.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob and his team are fitting a lift into a Spring City skyscraper, Scoop decides that he would like to see the view from the top.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor steers the school bus into a bog, and winds up getting stuck in the mud himself.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Bazza is horrible to his friends on his birthday, so no one wants to go to his party. Animation following the adventures of a helpful and happy little van.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Jethro dreams of scoring the winning goal in a game of football but worries he is too old, so Olly organises a match to help his friend fulfil his fantasy.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Mayor Goodway calls on the Paw Patrol to rescue her twin niece and nephew from a tree and then look after them for the day.(n)

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Blaze and Starla find a herd of cows wandering in the desert, and set out to bring them back to Starla's barn.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Slippery Stage.
programme.desc: Pat-Pat is meant to be giving a baton-twirling display at the Town Hall, but someone has spread slippery stuff on the stage, so Noddy decides to find out who is responsible.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Bert loses Barry's birthday present - a new waterhole - so Wissper summons Gertie the giraffe and Otis the oxpecker bird to help find it.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Three baby ladybirds stay at their uncle's for the day - but they are exhausting, so Ben and Holly help to keep them entertained.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Leah asks for help from the genies making cupcakes for a bake sale, but ends up with a giant birthday cake on her hands.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster decides she does not need any help and asks people to stop doing everything for her.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When Daddy Pig needs a new watch, Mr Fox finds three grandfather clocks in the back of his van. It seems that Mr Fox has everything in his van - even a chicken.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa paint a picture of a cherry tree.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy teaches the children how to play basketball, and they become so good at it they decide to compete against another team.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: All the Dads get the day off work to go and play in the meadow, while Ben and Holly are surprised to discover that someone they know is a father.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: Leo regrets forming an alliance with Karai when Donnie is injured in an attack on Shredder's chemical plant. Karai plans to destroy a robot factory, but stumbles into a trap.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Animals Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Another compilation of comical clips, this time featuring animals in zoos, safari parks and their natural habitat, with cheeky monkeys, a goat with a grudge and a loved-up llama. A mother and daughter's trip to the safari park turns into a nightmare when they are attacked by a one-eyed emu, and a woman's holiday takes an unexpected turn when she becomes the object of affection for a frisky dolphin. Animal behaviour therapist Professor Peter Neville joins Des Clarke and Zoe Lyons to provide a little scientific background to the these animal urges.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev Salter takes drastic action to stop a vehicle he suspects has class-A drugs on board, while a nasty street fight leads to a Taser being drawn. Mark Shepherd has his work cut out when a late-night pursuit heads off-road, and the arrest of a wanted man leads to drugs and a lethal weapon being discovered.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The return of the documentary following the work of a high-speed police interception unit, this time riding along with officers of Cheshire's elite crime-fighting team, whose patch is one of the UK's most affluent areas. In the first edition, Tom tries to stop a suspected petrol thief who is not willing to pull over, Bucko and Chris meet a mouthy driver who refuses to come quietly, Mike helps to carry out a textbook tactical pursuit and containment, and Jim deals with a drunk, foul-mouthed racist who has bladder-control issues.(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A rebellious, hip-swinging student from the city moves to a small religious community, where he instantly clashes with an old-school fire-and-brimstone preacher - who has banned dancing and rock 'n' roll because he considers them immoral. Drama, starring Kevin Bacon, Lori Singer, John Lithgow, Chris Penn, Dianne Wiest and Sarah Jessica Parker. Includes 5 News Update at 5.15pm.(n)

programme.title: Dirty Dancing
programme.desc: Premiere. Musical remake of the romantic drama. Abigail Breslin stars as an awkward teenager staying with her family at a holiday camp in the 1960s. She embarks on a life-changing romance with the camp's charismatic dance instructor (Colt Prattes), despite the disapproval of her parents and the condemnation of society in general. With Bruce Greenwood, Debra Messing and Billy Dee Williams. Edited for sexual content.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines, sports news and weather.(n)

programme.title: Dirty Dancing
programme.desc: Premiere. Musical remake of the romantic drama. Abigail Breslin stars as an awkward teenager staying with her family at a holiday camp in the 1960s. She embarks on a life-changing romance with the camp's charismatic dance instructor (Colt Prattes), despite the disapproval of her parents and the condemnation of society in general. With Bruce Greenwood, Debra Messing and Billy Dee Williams. Edited for sexual content.(n)

programme.title: Monster-in-Law
programme.desc: An unlucky-in-love woman thinks she has finally landed on her feet when she meets the man of her dreams. However, his meddling mother proves to be an overprotective nightmare who is adamant the would-be bride is Miss Wrong and hatches a plan to drive her away. Romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Jane Fonda and Michael Vartan.(n)

programme.title: That's So
programme.desc: A look back at 1982, featuring news, pop and TV archive clips. It was a year that saw the Falklands War, the birth of Prince William, Channel 4's launch together with the first episode of Countdown, and Steven Spielberg's ET: The Extra-Terrestrial break box office records. It was also the age of new romanticism and electropop, while tracks such as Come on Eileen, Eye of the Tiger and Pass the Dutchie stormed the charts.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Most Shocking Reality Moments
programme.desc: A celebration of the nation's long-running love affair with reality TV, showcasing the 50 most memorable moments from some of the best-loved shows such as TOWIE, Jersey Shore and Made in Chelsea. The bumper countdown includes the time George Galloway came over all feline on Celebrity Big Brother, Gillian McKeith's dramatic fainting episodes on I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, and Bobby Davro's belly flop on The Games. Featuring contributions by Calum Best, Charlotte Crosby, Amy Childs, Paul Danan, Janice Dickinson, Dane Bowers and Vanessa Feltz.(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: A plane crash leaves a compulsive workaholic stranded on a deserted island for more than four years, where he's forced to adjust to a new life of solitude(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: Inspired by the story of young Jesus Christ on his return from Egypt to Nazareth with his family. As Jesus grows into his religious identity, his family also learn to understand his nature and purpose during the journey(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Young widow Holly Kennedy discovers that her late husband has left her ten monthly messages intended to help ease her pain and start a new life. Adapted from Cecelia Ahern's best-selling novel. Starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler, Kathy Bates and Lisa Kudrow(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: The tumultuous life of New York-born entrepreneur Joy Mangano, whose invention of the Miracle Mop began the creation a business empire(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: Doomsday comes to LA in this gripping tale of terror, panic and paranoia. When dirty bombs are detonated over Southern California, a husband (Rory Cochrane) and his wife (Mary McCormack) become quarantined, he inside their house, she outside. As contaminated ash rains down from the sky, chaos reigns across the area as those left out in the open run the risk of being poisoned by the fatal toxins. The film is the directorial debut of production designer Chris Gorak, who also wrote the script(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this Western thriller(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Epic romantic adventure, set just prior to World War II, about an English aristocrat and the rugged drover who helps her with the cattle station she inherited(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An FBI agent goes undercover and infiltrates a group of extreme athletes in order to prove they are using their specialised skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. The film is inspired by the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Blind lawyer Matt Murdock, whose smell, touch, taste and hearing have been heightened as a result of a chemical accident, uses his superpowers to fight crime as the costumed vigilante Daredevil. With the help of Elektra, Murdock takes on mob boss Kingpin and his hired assassin Bullseye(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Cop Brian O'Conner goes undercover in LA's dangerous street- racing underworld to snare hard-driving car criminal Dominic Toretto(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Former LA cop Brian now makes his living driving in illegal street races in Miami. Squeezed by the FBI, he agrees to set up druglord Verone for a king-sized bust(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: A conservative writer who's sworn off dating is swept off her feet by a man who, she learns, works for an upscale dating service; and was hired to woo her by her best friend(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: It's the year 2054, and crime has been eradicated in Washington. Thanks to the foretelling skills of three mutants called Pre-cogs, the future can be predicted and the guilty ones are convicted before committing any offence. These three psychic beings are part of the elitist Pre-Crime unit, within the Department of Justice. For the time being, their predictions have never failed. No one works with more enthusiasm than its boss, John Anderton, who due to a tragic loss dedicates his life to this cutting-edge project. Anderton supports and promotes this perfect system until he becomes the main suspect(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This riveting crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Gubagude Ko
programme.desc: A man witnesses a rape but is racked with guilt for doing nothing to stop it.. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: Hoosiers tells the true story of a group of underdogs who become champions. Set in the 1950s, Hoosiers is about a hard-luck, unemployed college basketball coach (Gene Hackman) who gets a chance to coach a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team. Facing resentment from the community and the team itself, Hackman manages to inspire his young athletes, leading them to the state championship with the help of the assistant coach (Dennis Hopper), who happens to be a recovering alcoholic(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: An ambitious stock broker becomes the protégé of a ruthless corporate shark. Eventually the billionaire takes a financial interest in the airline company where the protégé's father has been employed for decades(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: In this thrilling fourth installment of the "Jurassic Park" franchise, two young brothers (Ty Simpkins and Nick Robinson) visit their Aunt Claire (Bryce Dallas Howard) who's an executive at Jurassic World, a theme park populated with genetically resurrected dinosaurs. But chaos erupts when a newly created dino escapes its enclosure, forcing the park's animal behaviorist Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) to save the day(n)

programme.title: Black Salt
programme.desc: An Interpol agent undertakes a mission to recover a deadly weapon of mass destruction(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: (2008) Angelina Jolie, James McAvoy and Morgan Freeman star in this violent action adventure from Russian director Timur Bekmambetov (Nightwatch, Daywatch). The life of office worker Wesley Gibson (McAvoy) has been one of frustration, disappointment and anxiety; he has an overbearing boss, his girlfriend and his best friend are duplicitously having an affair, and he's on medication to calm his nerves. To top it all, he one day finds himself on the wrong end of an assassination attempt. Luckily, the agile, honed and lethal Fox (Jolie) is at hand to save his life. However, she also reveals that his recently deceased father was secretly a supremely skilled killer, and that it's her job to ensure that Wesley takes his place in the Fraternity, the mystical organisation overseen by Sloan (Freeman), which exists to rid the world of evil-doers. And so begins Wesley's journey to unlock his hitherto unsuspected innate deadly abilities and use them for good. The cinematography echoes the inventiveness of Bekmambetov's earlier movies and takes a Matrix-like delight in playing with the tempo and camera angles of the fight scenes(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars in John Moore's video game-based CGI noir as a cop with vengeance on his mind. The eponymous NYPD detective's life is torn apart by the brutal murder of his wife and child. Determined to track down those responsible and wreak bloody revenge, he leaves no stone unturned. His dedication pays off when he investigates a tip-off about some drug dealers. They put him on the trail of the manufacturers of a dangerous new hallucinogen that makes its users violent and fearless. But, just as he seems to be making progress, he finds himself prime suspect for a murder he did not commit..(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn. This gut-busting comedy is a sequel to the 2012 surprise hit(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Based on the true story of the Deepwater Horizon drilling rig, which caused an oil spill. The worst U.S. oil spill disaster in history(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: An audacious blend of political satire, drama and action focuses on four GIs in Iraq at the end of the Gulf War who try to steal a cache of gold(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between an aspiring cop and his seasoned partner (and future brother-in-law) as they pursue a Miami drug lord together with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: A hard-nosed, hard-living Marine gunnery sergeant clashes with his superiors and his ex-wife as he takes command of a spoiled recon platoon with a bad attitude(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: A plane crash leaves a compulsive workaholic stranded on a deserted island for more than four years, where he's forced to adjust to a new life of solitude(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: Inspired by the story of young Jesus Christ on his return from Egypt to Nazareth with his family. As Jesus grows into his religious identity, his family also learn to understand his nature and purpose during the journey(n)

programme.title: Happy Gilmore
programme.desc: Adam Sandler's second popular starring vehicle after Billy Madison is a goofy lowbrow paean to golf, hockey, and the comic hysterics of its childlike star. In Happy Gilmore, Sandler plays the title character, a raw, determined, but ultimately untalented hockey player who keeps trying out for the pros. When Happy discovers his grandmother (Frances Bay) will lose her home if she doesn't fork over 270,000 dollars to the IRS, he tries to figure out how he can possibly scrounge up the cash. An idea strikes during a game of one-upmanship with a couple furniture movers stripping his grandmother's home: On his first-ever swing, he drives a golf ball farther than the movers have ever seen. Before long, he has transplanted the foul-mouthed, aggressive persona of the hockey rink to the links, winning an amateur tourney that earns him a spot on the pro tour. Throttling everyone from a helpless caddy to game show host Bob Barker during the course of his 90-day quest to amass prize money, Happy also wins the sport a legion of new fans with his in-your-face style. Guiding him on his quest is a whimsical retired pro who lost his hand to an alligator (Carl Weathers) and an attractive public relations woman charmed by Happy's antics (Julie Bowen). Opposing him, however, is sneering hotshot Shooter McGavin (Christopher McDonald), who will do anything to win his championship jacket and see Happy fail(n)

Romola Garai stars as the independent Emma Woodhouse, who believes she is a skilled matchmaker and tries to pair up her friends and acquaintances. She takes Harriet Smith under her wing and encourages the woman to set her sights higher than her current suitor - against Mr Knightley's warnings about the dangers of meddling. programme.title: Emma

programme.title: Emma

programme.title: Emma

programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: Father's Day: The Birthday Synchronicity.
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy's attempts to celebrate her birthday with an intimate night at home are interrupted by the news that Bernadette has gone into labour. however, it transpires that Howard, Raj and Stuart may have rushed the expectant mother to the hospital too early, with Raj having difficulty keeping the gender of the unborn child a secret.(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: A paraplegic soldier uses technology that allows him to control a genetically engineered body on a mission to a dangerous jungle world. His assignment is to infiltrate an alien tribe on behalf of a corrupt mining corporation, which wants to drive them from their land. He comes to sympathise with the natives, and helps them fight back against his employers. James Cameron's sci-fi adventure, starring Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver and Stephen Lang.(n)

Both of them become targets of Dave's twisted former friend, who has reinvented himself as the world's first supervillain. Action comedy sequel, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloe Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz-Plasse and Jim Carrey.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth.
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth.
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.(n)

programme.title: Death Proof
programme.desc: Stuntman Mike gets his kicks from killing young women using his high-powered car. But when he takes on four feisty girls, he might be on his last ride(n)

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: Four years later, Brody now finds himself in a race against time when a new killer shark attacks ten boats manned by teenagers, which include his own sons(n)

programme.title: A Simple Plan
programme.desc: Based on Scott B. Smith's bone-chilling 1993 novel, A Simple Plan is a bit of a departure for horror film director Sam Raimi. Instead of flying eyeballs and dancing corpses, A Simple Plan is a taut crime thriller in the vein of Joel Coen's Academy Award-winning Fargo. Set during the white winters of Minnesota, this story tells the eerie tale of Hank and Jacob Mitchell (played by Bill Paxton and Billy Bob Thornton) who, along with a buddy, find a downed single-engine plane buried in the snowy woods. Inside it is a decaying pilot and a bag carrying four million dollars in one-hundred-dollar bills. The men decide to hide the money until spring when the snow is melted and the plane is found. If no one notices the missing money at that time, they will split it and live a wealthy new life. A simple plan, right? Wrong. Much like Humphrey Bogart's The Treasure of the Sierra Madre, things can only get worse, as distrust and greed creep into the minds of the principals. They find it difficult to decide which one gets to hold the money -- and even more impossible to keep from dipping into the stash until spring. And so on. It also becomes increasingly tough to keep a secret of this magnitude. And if all this doesn't get moviegoers' brains working, it seems there are suspicious characters in town who just may be able to link them to the plane, forcing the more dangerous and bloody question of what to do with those people and how to cover their tracks(n)

Candy's trademark grown-up-who-never-grew-up act provides the perfect launch pad for domestic chaos and some cracking exchanges, topped by Miles' quickfire interrogation about Buck's personal life(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Artifact hunter and archaeologist extraordinaire Ben Franklin Gates learns of his own family's implication in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln by John Wilkes Booth. Gates must then locate an elusive diary, not only to clear his family's name, but to unearth and connect several secrets, buried within the book, that point to a massive, global conspiracy(n)

programme.title: The Touch
programme.desc: Peter Pau, the oscar winning cinematographer of Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, directed Tian Mai Chuanqi (The Touch). Pak Yin-fay (Michelle Yeoh) and Pak Yeuk-tong (Brandon Chang) are siblings in a family of acrobats. Bad guy Karl (Richard Roxburgh) employs gifted thief/acrobat Eric (Ben Chaplain) to steal an item created in the 1200s. Eric is successful, but the fact that he is Yin-fay's adopted brother makes his motivations less than clear. While everyone attempts to possess the item, it is Yeuk-tong who ends up with it. He and his girlfriend take off with the object, with all of the other characters in pursuit(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: In this documentary centered on legendary filmmaker John Ford's cinematic contributions to Allied morale during World War II, actor/musician Kris Kristofferson narrates as the How Green Was My Valley director turns his back on Tinseltown in order to fulfill his patriotic duty. By the time the United States became involved in World War II, John Ford was already a film legend, but when Uncle Sam came calling the veteran filmmaker eagerly packed his bags and set his sites on the frontlines. Though Ford did sustain battlefield injuries during the production of the Oscar-winning documentary The Battle of Midway, the remarkable film endeared him to patriotic American audiences across the country and his next wartime effort, 1943's December 7th, proceeded to earn the filmmaker yet another Oscar. In addition to featuring footage from these and other, lesser-known wartime films from Ford, this documentary also offers an intimate look at the complex filmmaker and explores his remarkable legacy through both archive footage and interviews with such notable directors as Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich(n)

programme.title: Fortress
programme.desc: A glossy high-tech, futuristic sci-fi exterior does little to conceal the fact that this gory actioner is little more than a cliche-ridden prison movie--a movie that found tremendous popularity internationally. Set amidst an overpopulated, oppressed future U.S., it centers on the struggles of a defiant young couple who decide to have a second baby after the first dies. Unfortunately, the law states that each woman can only have one child. It is irrelevant whether the child survives or not. The couple attempts to make it safely out of the country, but they are captured and sentenced to spend three decades in the dreaded, corporate-owned Fortress, a grim place where lasers replace iron bars and inmates are controlled via radio-operated pain-inflicting intestinal devices. Incorrigible prisoners are forced to have their identities erased by a "mind wipe" machine. The prison is controlled by a sadistic cyborg warden and a robot army. The warden wants to make the woman's baby into a cyborg too. The warden also finds the wife very attractive. Meanwhile the husband begins making friends with his cellmate in hopes of finding a way to disable the surveillance system in time to save his wife and somehow escape(n)
