programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica investigates when the conflict between a mining company and a group of Native Americans over land rights leads to murder. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury as the crime writer with a sideline in solving mysteries.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A travelling circus brings burglary and murder to Cabot Cove. Meanwhile, Sheriff Mort Metzger suffers painful memories when he sees a former girlfriend who left him for another man. Starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits the zoo to research her latest novel, where a venomous snake kills an animal rights activist. Mystified as to how the black mamba could escape, the amateur sleuth tries to discover whether there was a human hand behind the incident. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Darling Buds of May - Part One.
programme.desc: The first episode of the whimsical rural drama based on HE Bates' novels. Tax collector Cedric Charlton visits the Larkin household intent on getting the head of the family - Pop - to correctly fill out his tax forms. In so doing he falls for attractive daughter Mariette. Starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Darling Buds of May - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Taxman Charley decides to escape from the office and go strawberry-picking with Mariette and the rest of the Larkin family - a move that leaves his career hanging in the balance. Light-hearted drama based on the novels by HE Bates, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris, Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Death on the Nile
programme.desc: Detective Hercule Poirot investigates a murder on board a paddle steamer in Egypt. The victim was an unpopular heiress, whose outspoken manner put her at odds with most of her fellow passengers during their cruise on the Nile. Agatha Christie mystery, starring Peter Ustinov, Bette Davis, Maggie Smith, George Kennedy, Mia Farrow, Jane Birkin, Olivia Hussey, Angela Lansbury and David Niven.(n)

programme.title: Death on the Nile
programme.desc: Detective Hercule Poirot investigates a murder on board a paddle steamer in Egypt. programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A visiting American academic delivers a controversial speech, with many audience members worried his ideas could be used to target ethnic minorities. So when he is found hanged the next morning and Dr Hobson quickly discounts suicide, Lewis and Hathaway realise they have many suspects - from the local anti-racism activist who was first in voicing her disgust at the professor's beliefs to the women who had bombarded him with threatening e-mails. But then another body turns up and the case takes on a new dimension. David Soul and Patrick Baladi guest star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth is called to Gossington Hall by her old friend Dolly Bantry (Joanna Lumley) when she finds the corpse of an unknown blonde in the library of her home. It soon transpires that there is no shortage of suspects, including local bad boy Basil Blake (Ben Miller) and Dolly's husband Arthur (James Fox), but when the victim is identified as a dancer in line to inherit a fortune, enquiries take a different turn. Crime drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Simon Callow, Jack Davenport and Tara Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A Midsomer Malham resident is accused of battering her best friend to death, but Barnaby cannot help feeling the evidence against her does not add up. The detective enlists the help of a pensioner, who also happens to be one of the key witnesses, to find out what really happened on the night of the murder - and realises the elderly lady's life could be at risk. With John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Thelma Barlow.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: Foyle responds to complaints of sabotage at an RAF burns hospital and uncovers adultery and murder within the medical unit. As the hunt for the guilty party intensifies, the detective discovers his son Andrew could be a suspect and is shocked when he hears he has been reported missing from his barracks. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen, John Wood, Honeysuckle Weeks and Julian Ovenden.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin are mystified by the murders of a popular couple who were stabbed to death while they slept. Lacking any leads to possible grievances held or enemies made, the detectives suspect a case of mistaken identity, and the previous owner of the house - a banker caught up in a hedge-fund scandal - emerges as the more likely target. Guest starring Samuel West.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The team struggles to understand the involvement of 12-year-old Kaden Blake in the shooting of mother and carer Lia Brown. As a victim of gang culture, the boy's only protection is keeping silent, and by speaking out about the crime, he sets in motion a devastating chain of events. Guest starring Lucy Speed (EastEnders, The Bill), with Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: DS Sam Casey, a young officer with a strong sense of justice, is brought in to investigate the shooting of Devlin outside the Old Bailey, and is surprised to learn the gunman was specifically targeting police officers. The case sees the whole team emotionally spent, with the trial itself at risk of being derailed by a politically driven defence lawyer (Colin Salmon) with an axe to grind. Crime drama, starring Bradley Walsh, Freema Agyeman and Paul Nicholls, who joins the cast.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: With Arthur having been gone for six months, Stan accompanies his sister Olive to the divorce courts. Reg Varney and Anna Karen star.(n)

programme.title: ITV3 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth is called to Gossington Hall by her old friend Dolly Bantry (Joanna Lumley) when she finds the corpse of an unknown blonde in the library of her home. It soon transpires that there is no shortage of suspects, including local bad boy Basil Blake (Ben Miller) and Dolly's husband Arthur (James Fox), but when the victim is identified as a dancer in line to inherit a fortune, enquiries take a different turn. Crime drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Simon Callow, Jack Davenport and Tara Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve Crane's wayward mother Babs arrives in Aidensfield, having fallen out with her screenwriter boyfriend and grown tired of the London arts scene. She causes all manner of chaos when a spate of burglaries provides her with the ideal opportunity to put her self-defence skills into practice. Meanwhile, Vernon Scripps has an amazing change in fortune. Rural drama, starring James Carlton.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A dangerous ex-con returns to Aidensfield hoping to exact revenge on Merton, the officer who apprehended him, and takes Jenny hostage. Meanwhile, the village is rocked by a spate of car thefts and Vernon organises a charity auction. Drama, starring Duncan Bell, Sarah Tansey and Paul Brennan.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica attends a writers' seminar in Amsterdam and ends up investigating the disappearance of an old friend, suspected to have been kidnapped. Starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits Genoa in Italy, where she finds her sleuthing skills called upon in the world of opera when a soprano is threatened by a stranger hidden in the foggy night. Murder mystery, starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American businessman travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris tries to hire Hercule Poirot to discover the source of the death threats that have been made against him. The sleuth refuses, but wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow - and there is no shortage of suspects among the passengers. Agatha Christie mystery, starring Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Ingrid Bergman, Sean Connery and Vanessa Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Murder on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American businessman travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris tries to hire Hercule Poirot to discover the source of the death threats that have been made against him. The sleuth refuses, but wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow - and there is no shortage of suspects among the passengers. Agatha Christie mystery, starring Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Ingrid Bergman, Sean Connery and Vanessa Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: A blizzard forces the sleuthing spinster to spend a night in isolated Sittaford House, situated on a Devon moor. Without explanation, the building's owner, up-and-coming politician Clive Trevelyan, decides to spend the evening in a local hotel - only for a Ouija board to predict his murder. Mystery drama with an all-star cast, including Geraldine McEwan, Robert Hardy, Matthew Kelly, Patricia Hodge and Mel Smith.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: Foyle responds to complaints of sabotage at an RAF burns hospital and uncovers adultery and murder within the medical unit. As the hunt for the guilty party intensifies, the detective discovers his son Andrew could be a suspect and is shocked when he hears he has been reported missing from his barracks. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen, John Wood, Honeysuckle Weeks and Julian Ovenden.(n)

programme.title: Tonight at the Palladium
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the revived variety show, introducing a line-up of acts from around the world. Topping the bill are disco legends Earth, Wind & Fire with a selection of their greatest hits, and fellow American band Maroon 5 make a rare UK appearance to perform Maps. Former X Factor contestant Ella Henderson performs the song Glow, and Evita star Madalena Alberto graces the stage with a classic song from the musical. Plus, Canadian acrobats Les 7 Doigts de la Main and some of the biggest names in comedy.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Animal Orphans
programme.desc: Comedian Paul O'Grady presents the second of two reports from Borneo. He meets a five-year-old orang-utan that broke its arm in a fall from a tree, and is now having physiotherapy. But even if the fracture heals, will the patient have the confidence to start climbing again? The comedian also visits a centre dedicated to the conservation of sun bears - after pandas, the second most endangered bears in the world - and is introduced to a slow loris. Often sold illegally as pets, this one was so stressed it chewed off its own fingers and now needs to be taught to eat its usual diet of insects.(n)

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress flies over Tokyo in a helicopter. The city was bombed extensively during the Second World War, so almost all of it is a symbol of the post-war economic boom that saw Japan become the world's second largest economy. While in the capital, Joanna heads out to a nightclub to see a Japanese girl band and witnesses the largely male audience perform almost as much as the artists on stage. Later, Joanna travels to the Kiso Valley to walk the Nakasendo Way, an ancient route that once linked Tokyo to Kyoto, a place best known for that most famous of Japanese traditions, the Geisha.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Ronnie and Sam are given 10 hours to find a hostage who was taken by two armed men, following a bungled robbery in which an innocent `have-a-go-hero' was shot dead. When one of the accused is seized, the team is offered a deal - he will tell them the location of the captive in return for immunity from prosecution. Tamzin Outhwaite guest stars as uncompromising lawyer Miriam Pescatore.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks is forced to reopen a 14-year-old case when a dying crack addict confesses to the murder of teenager Amanda Bennet, a crime for which her father Simon (guest star Tim McInnerny) was originally convicted. Brooks becomes torn between the belief of his former partner Bernie Rawlins and mounting doubts over the ability of current colleague Casey, and the case unearths the possibility that more ghosts from his drinking days will come back to haunt him. Starring Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls.(n)

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: A woman is tormented by calls from her supposedly deceased husband, whose lifeless body was pulled from the sea several weeks earlier. While she is admitted to a sanatorium to prevent a nervous breakdown, Templar works on the premise that her spouse may indeed still be alive. Roger Moore and Sylvia Syms star.(n)

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Templar has to find out whether a cool blonde is a secret agent or a crook - and if she could do him harm. Sixties spy adventure, directed by and starring Roger Moore.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Thruxton, featuring the F4 British Championship and the Renault UK Clio Cup.(n)

programme.title: BRDC Formula 3 Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the fourth round of the season at Silverstone, which was set to feature the 10th, 11th and 12th races of the season.(n)

programme.title: ITV Racing: The Opening Show
programme.desc: Rishi Persad, Luke Harvey and Richard Fahey look ahead to the day's racing at York, Musselburgh and Sandown Park, and present a preview of Royal Ascot.(n)

programme.title: The Classic Car Show
programme.desc: Quentin Willson tries to rehabilitate the reputation of the MGB sports car, while Alex Riley watches his childhood hero Derek Bell get back into a Porsche 962 and compete in the Group C support race at Le Mans. Jodie Kidd and her husband David Blakely take part in the Mille Miglia endurance race in a 1953 Jaguar XK120 drophead coupe, and Bruno Senna puts a 1963 Jaguar lightweight E-type through its paces on the handling track.(n)

programme.title: British Touring Car Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Steve Rider presents action from round five at Croft, where the 13th, 14th and 15th races of the season were set to take place. Commentary by David Addison and Tim Harvey.(n)

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present coverage of today's races. From York, races start at 1.50, 2.20, 2.55 and 3.30. From Musselburgh, at 2.05 and 3.10. From Sandown Park, at 2.40. Analysis and reporting comes from Luke Harvey, Rishi Persad and Matt Chapman, and commentary by Richard Hoiles.(n)

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny makes a risky purchase at a car auction, and ends up with a vehicle that may be past saving.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a custom-built Harley Davidson rat bike, and appraise an oil painting by Jim Daly. However, a painful staff mishap leaves them one person short.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An intriguing Civil War pistol stokes the guys' interest, while a purportedly genuine signed photo of ex-president Benjamin Harrison comes under scrutiny.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A particularly eclectic selection lies in store for the pawn shop staff, including a letter signed by Napoleon Bonaparte, a set of 1940s Las Vegas police badges and an antique pogo stick.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team goes wild for a collection of signed Metallica memorabilia and a first edition copy of 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys stumble on a collection of Beatles memorabilia signed by all four members of the group, and try to find a new hobby for the Old Man.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey take a look at a 1951 Chevy driven by Steve McQueen in his final film, while a man brings in a Colt .45 allegedly used to shoot Jesse James.(n)

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A security guard is murdered during a payroll snatch, and Regan and Carter are called in to support local investigating officers. However, bad blood between the maverick detective inspector and the force's chief superintendent going back several years manifests itself in an old allegation of corruption being rekindled. Richard Griffiths features alongside John Thaw and Dennis Waterman in the final episode of the crime drama.(n)

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge
programme.desc: Ellen Brody, the widow of heroic police chief Martin Brody, travels to the Bahamas after her youngest son is killed by a great white shark. But as she is reunited with her surviving son, the predatory fish sets off in pursuit to wipe out the entire family. Thriller sequel, starring Michael Caine, Lorraine Gary, Lance Guest and Mario Van Peebles.(n)

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs
programme.desc: Criminals are employed by a crime boss to carry out a diamond robbery that goes disastrously wrong. In the bloody aftermath of the heist, they try to establish what happened and how the police were aware of their plans all along - leading to the hardening suspicion that one of them betrayed the gang. Quentin Tarantino's thriller, starring Harvey Keitel, Tim Roth, Michael Madsen, Chris Penn and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs

programme.title: Life on the Limit
programme.desc: Documentary examining the world of Formula One racing in the 1960s and 1970s, an era when motor sport was at its most dangerous. The film tells the stories of the drivers who became iconic celebrities risking their lives on the track, and how many went on to campaign for better safety conditions in the wake of several fatal crashes. Narrated by Michael Fassbender.(n)

programme.desc: Coverage of the final (Kick-off 3.00pm), which comes from Mikheil Meskhi Stadium in Tbilisi, Georgia. Presented by Martin Bayfield, with analysis from Ugo Monye and David Flatman.(n)

programme.desc: The guys examine a pennant from the baseball world series signed by Frank Sinatra and a replica of the car from Back to the Future.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.desc: Cameroon v Chile (Kick-off 7.00pm). Coverage of the opening match in Group B, which takes place at Otkrytiye Arena in Moscow, Russia. Cameroon will come into this tournament full of confidence following their success at the Africa Cup of Nations back in February, as they face the winners of the 2015 staging of the Copa America. Presented by Jacqui Oatley, with commentary by Sam Matterface and Iain Dowie, and analysis from Mark Schwarzer and Matthew Upson.(n)

programme.title: Hard to Kill
programme.desc: A gang of drug dealers attacks the home of a Los Angeles cop, leaving him in a coma and his wife dead. Seven years later, he regains consciousness and gets ready to exact a grisly payback on the murderers. As he embarks on his deadly mission of vengeance, he learns his son also survived the attack, but was told he is dead. Thriller, with Steven Seagal, Kelly LeBrock, Bill Sadler and Frederick Coffin.(n)

programme.title: Hard to Kill
programme.desc: A gang of drug dealers attacks the home of a Los Angeles cop, leaving him in a coma and his wife dead. Seven years later, he regains consciousness and gets ready to exact a grisly payback on the murderers. As he embarks on his deadly mission of vengeance, he learns his son also survived the attack, but was told he is dead. Thriller, with Steven Seagal, Kelly LeBrock, Bill Sadler and Frederick Coffin.(n)

programme.title: Out for Justice
programme.desc: A tough Brooklyn cop learns that his partner and best friend has been murdered in front of his family by a vicious drug dealer, the pair's lifelong enemy and the scourge of the neighbourhood. The detective heads into the underworld on a one-man vengeance mission, but finds the killer's criminal bosses are also hunting for him. Action thriller, with Steven Seagal, William Forsythe and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew's terminally ill mother asks him to help end her life, while back in Cardale, the past catches up with scheming locum Dr Nick Goodson, exposing his web of lies and deceit in spectacular fashion. Gary Mavers, Saskia Wickham, Adrian Lukis and Thomas Lockyer star.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack congratulates himself on having got the better of Robert in the run-up to the risk-management inquiry, but just when everything seems to be going his way, he goes and causes a road accident . To make matters worse, he's been banned from driving, and shouldn't have been behind the wheel of a car in the first place, which understandably makes it hard for him to keep his mind on his job. Worried and distracted, he makes a grave error of judgement, and suddenly finds himself struggling to cover his tracks. Meanwhile, Sam finds herself on the receiving end of Christine's wrath over a malicious rumour. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack, with a guest appearance by Jane Danson's real-life partner Robert Beck.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's interview with the management consultants doesn't go as planned when it ends up as a painful self-analysis of his ability as a doctor, but although his skills on the wards and in the operating theatre prove otherwise, it's enough to make the beleaguered doc hand in his resignation. Arch-enemy Jack is over the moon about the turn of events and reckons his day couldn't get any better, blissfully unaware that Christine has got her hands on a copy of an X-ray that proves his own shortcomings. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Customs seize a massive heroin shipment and Kavanagh agrees to prosecute the importer, a self-made man with all the trappings of success, including a yacht and a villa in Portugal. Unfortunately, he also has a staff of hired heavies who make the mistake of threatening Lizzie in a bid to get him off the hook - thus setting the scene for a bitterly personal courtroom wrangle. John Thaw and Lisa Harrow star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A London policeman and his doctor wife encounter hostility and suspicion when they move to a close-knit Yorkshire community, but feuding mods and rockers, a mysterious prowler and a budgie-killer mean the couple soon find themselves in the thick of village life. First-ever episode of the popular Sixties-set drama, starring Nick Berry, Niamh Cusack, Derek Fowlds and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick pursues a moorland flasher and drunken hikers, while Kate suffers abuse at the hands of a bullying husband. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Tragedy casts a dark shadow over the idyllic landscape of Aidensfield when Nick receives an anonymous tip-off about a local shopkeeper's unsavoury antics. Meanwhile, Greengrass finds himself in trouble courtesy of the village gossip-mongers. Sixties-based rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: King Edward VII visits Eaton Place for a lavish dinner party, but the servants' duties are interrupted by the untimely appearance of Sarah, who is unfortunately expecting a new arrival of her own. Gordon Jackson and Jean Marsh star.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: A lovelorn, smooth-talking minstrel turns to Robin and his outlaw band for help in rescuing his beloved from the Sheriff of Nottingham's clutches. Michael Praed stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. While holidaying in Cornwall with his friend Captain Hastings, Poirot meets a local woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play. David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Belgian sleuth's Cornish holiday comes to a dramatic conclusion as he unravels the mystery behind the series of disastrous near-misses that placed the life of a beautiful heiress in danger, and as the truth comes to light, a secret engagement is revealed. David Suchet stars, with Philip Jackson and Hugh Fraser.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls victim to depression after failing to prevent the murder of a society girl by notorious art thief Marrascaud. His confidence shattered, Poirot eventually returns to work when a lonely chauffeur begs him to find his missing soulmate, the maid of a famous Russian dancer. The investigation takes him to the Swiss Alps, where, against all odds, he stumbles upon a hotel thought to be Marrascaud's hideout - leading to a very personal showdown. The penultimate episode of the long-running detective drama, starring David Suchet, with Simon Callow, Orla Brady, Patrick Ryecart, Nigel Lindsay, Morven Christie, Tom Austen and Rupert Evans.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Respected surgeon Dan Marsden is shot dead days before his retirement and his teenage daughters Mira and Karen are abducted. Joined by a new addition to the ranks, Vera investigates a mysterious parcel and a connection to the Iraq War as she races against time to catch the killer and save the girls. However, the case soon takes a violent and unexpected turn, striking at the heart of the team. Guest starring Saskia Reeves (Luther) and Dean Andrews (Ashes to Ashes), with Brenda Blethyn, David Leon and Gareth Farr.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Young physiotherapist Lizzie Faulkner is shot dead while enjoying a holiday at a luxury country retreat. The resulting murder investigation unearths betrayal, guilt and the desire for atonement - as Vera moves quickly to avoid another tragedy, and Joe tries to make amends with the demons of his past. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Paul Ritter and Eva Quinn. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part one of two. The detective receives a disturbing phone message from estranged brother Roy and heads to Harrogate to find him. Meanwhile at a murder scene, the team is introduced to new recruit Helen Morton, who quickly alienates her colleagues with her tactless style. The officer then makes matters worse when she finds evidence linking Banks to the victim's body and speculates he could be a suspect. Unaware everyone is searching for him, the DCI begins to delve into Roy's life and soon uncovers questionable business transactions and associates. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, with Caroline Catz (Doc Martin) and Andrea Lowe.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part two of two. The detective visits his childhood home to break the news of Roy's death, and his parents plead with him to find out what happened. Defying Morton, Banks returns to the station in an attempt to lead the investigation into the murders of his brother and Jennifer Lewis, and both officers are convinced the key to cracking the cases lies with a woman being treated at a clinic. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: The Level
programme.desc: As police comb the Le Saux haulage yard for clues, Nancy realises to her horror that she's left incriminating evidence at the scene. Worse follows when she learns her mother has gone missing from her psychiatric ward. In due course, as the shocking contents of the truck are revealed, the case seems close to being solved. However, Nancy knows there's more - and that the killer is still at large. Karla Crome, Robert James-Collier and Lindsey Coulson star.(n)

programme.title: Marcella
programme.desc: In her desperate hunt for Matthew, Marcella questions Henry at his home. Meanwhile, the pressure mounts on Jason as Tim's investigation into the murder of Andrew Barnes gathers pace, and the killer is finally revealed, causing shockwaves among the entire team. Crime drama by The Bridge creator Hans Rosenfeldt, starring Anna Friel and Harry Lloyd. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Customs seize a massive heroin shipment and Kavanagh agrees to prosecute the importer, a self-made man with all the trappings of success, including a yacht and a villa in Portugal. Unfortunately, he also has a staff of hired heavies who make the mistake of threatening Lizzie in a bid to get him off the hook - thus setting the scene for a bitterly personal courtroom wrangle. John Thaw and Lisa Harrow star.(n)

programme.title: Drama Trails
programme.sub-title: Secret Diary of a Call Girl to Cadfael.
programme.desc: Connections between the saucy shenanigans of ITV's Secret Diary of a Call Girl, starring Billie Piper, and monastic murder mystery series Cadfael, based on the books by Ellis Peters and starring Derek Jacobi as the sleuthing monk.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack is thrilled that his plan seems to have worked, but Christine soon wipes the smile off his face when she produces the missing X-ray and forces him to confess to the misdiagnosis, while Robert gains the upper hand as he issues his arch-enemy with an ultimatum - stand down as Clinical Director or face the consequences. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A coach crash on the M62 causes chaos for the staff as A&E is overrun with patients needing treatment, while Sam is shocked to find her badly beaten brother waiting at reception. Elsewhere, new doctor Danny has a baptism of fire when he informs the wrong family of a patient's death - and later gets held up at gunpoint, along with Robert, by a man seeking revenge for the death of his son. Starring Martin Shaw and James Murray.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Dashing TV doctor James Da Costa sets pulses racing as he arrives to attend an interview for the post of clinical director, although he fails to impress his old teacher Jack, who doesn't relish working alongside his egotistical former star pupil. Meanwhile, a pregnant woman with a fractured pelvis is in danger of losing her baby and a teenage girl collapses with severe stomach pains due to liver failure. Medical drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Ben Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The old poem about the boy standing on the burning deck takes on new meaning as Kavanagh defends two Navy officers accused of arson, and finds he cannot use his only defence. It is a tough case, and the last thing he needs is extra stress at home - but that does not stop the children planning an anniversary party without telling him. With Andy Serkis, Ray Winstone and Geraldine James.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Clare begins to lose her grip on reality altogether, while David has an unscheduled run-in with glamorous old flame Anna Bradshaw, and it isn't long before sparks are flying again - in more ways than one. Adrian Lukis, Caroline Langrishe and Gary Mavers star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick's relationship with Kate suffers when he goes for a job interview in London, and Greengrass is convicted for sheep rustling, although holes in the evidence are discovered. Meanwhile, Alan Maskell leaves the area while on bail for and unbeknown to him, his wife suffers a miscarriage at the same time. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A feud between warring neighbours turns into a siege when Nick is held at gunpoint. Meanwhile, Kate puts her own life at risk to save a dying man. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Captain Hammond's former batman tries to blackmail Lady Marjorie with incriminating letters she wrote three years previously. Seventies drama, starring Gordon Jackson, Angela Baddeley and Joan Benham.(n)

programme.title: Dandelion Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama set in the 1920s, starring Michael Kitchen as a downtrodden, henpecked solicitor who buys a quantity of arsenic to kill the dandelions on his lawn, and suddenly realises it could be used to solve the problem of his wife as well. With Sarah Miles and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. While holidaying in Cornwall with his friend Captain Hastings, Poirot meets a local woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play. David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Belgian sleuth's Cornish holiday comes to a dramatic conclusion as he unravels the mystery behind the series of disastrous near-misses that placed the life of a beautiful heiress in danger, and as the truth comes to light, a secret engagement is revealed. David Suchet stars, with Philip Jackson and Hugh Fraser.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: Margo takes great pride in her new job at the surgery, but after a chance encounter with a recluse, she begins to realise where her greatest talent lies. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Trecarne House in Liskeard, Cornwall, where owners Trish and Tom Brock-Morgan hope to demonstrate that their B&B offers the best value for money. The pair win the group's admiration by sharing their life story, but one guest stirs up intrigue by holding his cards close to his chest.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners spend their second night of the competition at the Magna Carta at Windsor in Berkshire, a five-star floating bed and breakfast run by Captain Dominic Read. The guests are pleasantly surprised upon arrival, but not all are impressed by the standard of the accommodation - and a cracked teapot at the breakfast table leads to trouble for the proprietor.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is Ash Cottage near Leeds Castle in Kent, where the unusual decor is an eye-opener for the guests but is not everyone's cup of tea. Trish and Tom get heated over the instant coffee before owners Rayne and Chris Deal take their fellow contestants to Chatham Dockyard to try their hands at rope-making.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final guest house of the week is A Room with a View in Brighton, where owner Stephen Bull and housekeeper Joanna Harris hope their nine-room establishment will impress the contestants. Things get off to a good start when Rayne and Chris Deal are impressed by the cleanliness of the property, but things take a turn for the worse when breakfast gets the thumbs down.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their critics face-to-face. Hosts of Trecarne House in Cornwall Trish and Tom Brock-Morgan raise issues with Magna Carta's Dominic Read on his mark for their hosting, while he has a bone to pick with them over criticism of his five-star floating B&B. Stephen and Joanna of A Room with a View in Brighton receive complaints about their breakfast, and tensions run high as the payments are revealed and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.sub-title: Colne Estuary v Canal du Midi.
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps a couple with a love of barges and canals downsize to a property near a waterway so they can pursue their ideal lifestyle and hobbies. Lisa would like to relocate to the Colne Estuary in Essex, but her partner Michael is drawn to the Canal du Midi in southern France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Laura Hamilton come to the aid of Paul and Ann Cruxton as they decide whether to relocate to Folkestone, Kent, or the south of France with their £300,000 budget as they plan for their retirement.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the countryside surrounding Edinburgh helping Ian find a new home - but it soon becomes clear that he is more interested in finding the right shed for his collection of cars and tools than somewhere to lay his head. Phil Spencer is with Rogan and Jane, who suffer from chronic indecision when it comes to house hunting - and that's the least thing they need as they have to find a home fast before their first baby arrives in three months' time.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The culinary competition comes from in and around Preston, where the first to host is 29-year-old men's barber Lottie, affectionately known as Foghorn.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Second to host in Preston is support worker Martin Ainsworth, who hopes his menu of classics with a twist will go down a treat with his guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fragrance seller Justina is hoping to wow her guests in Preston with a vegan menu and performs reiki on her food to make sure she is in with a chance of winning the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night of the competition in and around Preston arrives, and confident company director Anthony Smith finally gets his chance to shine. He hopes a winning mix of finger-licking food and fine dining will be enough to secure him the £1,000 prize, but first he much knock Lottie off the top spot.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Built nearly a century before the British canal system, the Canal du Midi in the south of France has been designated a world heritage site. Timothy West and Prunella Scales explore a picturesque stretch, as is it meanders toward the Mediterranean. They visit the town of Beziers and the Malpas Tunnel - Europe's first navigable canal tunnel - and taste the delights of lamb's brain fritters, as well as brandy that is almost 200 years old.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Timothy West and Prunella Scales go in search of the lost route between London and the sea, which has not been fully open for more than 200 years and requires four different boats to traverse now. They leave the Thames at Teddington and travel through the Surrey and Sussex countryside before arriving at Guildford, and a canal-side theatre where they have both regularly performed. The final leg of the trip brings them to the River Arun before reaching the English Channel.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Timothy West and Prunella Scales travel down the Stratford-upon-Avon Canal, accompanied by Tim's daughter and her family. The couple revisit places that hold fond memories from the early stages of their relationship, as well as looking back on the beginnings of their acting careers and putting on a performance in the church where Shakespeare is buried.(n)

programme.title: Rivers with Jeremy Paxman
programme.desc: The presenter explores the Severn, Britain's longest river, which flows through both England and Wales. Along the way, he visits the largest ship graveyard in the country, meets the last practitioners of an unusual form of fishing, and takes part in a coracle regatta. He finally reaches the source of the river, where he meets a local poet.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from the 1970s, focusing on the comedies, documentaries and public information films that made people so anxious 40 years ago. Some of the famous shows covered include Man Alive and Brass Tacks, as well as The Goodies taking on the police and June Whitfield burning her bra. The show features first-hand accounts from the people who were making telly at the time, including Barry Cryer, Janet Street-Porter and Bill Oddie.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, revisiting the time of revolution on the small screen in the 1980s. This edition focuses on the concept of fear, dealing with the threats of heroin, glue-sniffing and Aids, Keith Chegwin assessing the impact of video nasties and a young Jeremy Paxman discussing how to survive a nuclear war. With contributions by Joan Bakewell, Nigel Farage, Jennie Bond and Chris Tarrant.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson join forces with Jason Manford and Roisin Conaty respectively. Sam Simmons helps the show's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr invites Sean Lock and Rob Beckett to go up against Jon Richardson and Cariad Lloyd in the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz. Jamie Laing joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock are joined by guests Craig Revel Horwood, Rick Edwards, David O'Doherty and Ellie Taylor, who answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today. Extended edition of the irreverent panel show, presented by Jimmy Carr.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in south-west London to help another two couples find their dream home. Long-distance partners Jason and Jaye are looking for a one-bed pad with outside space in Clapham or Brixton to finally bring them together, while Hannah and Frank want a family home before they get married - but have viewed nearly 50 properties without finding the one they want.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps Cheshire homeowners Katie, Helen and Stephen, and Jane and Ed make their houses more appealing to potential buyers Paul and Hannah.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Construction project manager David Fitzmaurice and his wife Joyce Wee moved to Christchurch to build a home out of shipping containers after the devastating earthquakes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Salon owner Hannah hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Devon, hoping to impress her guests with a menu bursting with taste sensations.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second dinner party in Devon is hosted by funeral director and BMX fanatic Simon, who hopes his big portions and `man food' will win him the cash prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Body artist Pascale hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Devon, preparing a Vietnamese menu full of flavour and colour in an effort to impress her guests enough to win the £1,000 prize money. However, her cooking attire for the starter leaves little to the imagination, Nick and Simon find some unusual artwork in her bedroom, Hannah discovers an unwanted guest in her main course, and Nick hits a nerve with Ajay.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nick hosts the fourth night in Devon, preparing a menu that he hopes represents his personality - big, bold and brash - although after his argument with Ajay, he is planning on turning down the banter. However, salon owner Hannah is not impressed with Nick's venison main and ladybird-loving Pascale finds the portions a bit too big. But undertaker Simon is happy to polish off any leftovers - is Nick in with a chance of bagging the £1,000 prize?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Ajay hopes her nautical-themed evening will see her sail to victory on the fifth and final night in Devon. Along with a gigantic seafood spread, she has also laid on a boat trip around Torquay harbour. However, all does not go quite to plan in the galley. The guests later gather to discover who has won the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is Nateby Inn in Cumbria, where landlady Gaynor Walker is ready with a warm welcome. A trip to Gaynor's local brewery turns out to be a barrel of laughs when one guest beats another in a cask-rolling competition, before a broken cooker creates chaos in the kitchen the following morning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Outfields Farm Bed and Breakfast in Ravensden, Bedfordshire, on their second stay, where proprietors Graham and Julia Ashley treat them to an afternoon of indoor sky-diving before hosting a dinner filled with surprises. The guests enjoy a good night's sleep, but one of the owners is expecting hassle at breakfast time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to At Home in Chiswick, west London, where artist Bob Osbourne appears to take a rather laid-back approach to running his B&B. On arrival, guests are pleasantly surprised by their first impressions of the communal living space-come-mini art gallery - but it's not long before they are dishing the dirt.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition draws to a close at the Ammonite Lodge guesthouse in Chard, Somerset, where owners Andrew and Clare Ashmore hope to excite their guests with a game of skittles. During the final dinner of the week, the competitors discuss their first impressions of each other, and Bob and Julia share some amusing observations with the group.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners confront their critics face to face, and the winners are announced. Nateby Inn host Gaynor takes issue with Graham and Julia's reduced marks for cobwebs. The conversation becomes heated when Outfields Farm's owners tackle Gaynor's complaints in return, and Georgie jumps to their defence. Artist Bob Osborne has a long list of grievances he wants to address, and Julia is left cringing when her previous comments rebound on her.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Performing arts teacher Helen hosts the first dinner party in Sheffield, but her flamboyant cooking does not go to according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Design and technology teacher Claire hosts the second day of the competition in Sheffield, and hopes her Asian-inspired menu with a spot of clay model-making will impress her fellow diners enough to net her the points she'll need to secure the cash prize. However, former chef Simon Hollings proves difficult to faze, and the eccentric Helen irritates the other contestants with another audacious display at the dinner table.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Service administrator Monika hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Sheffield. She treats her guests to a traditional Bulgarian night inspired by her homeland, in the hope of impressing them enough to win the £1,000 prize money. However, some of the guests are unsure about her Bulgarian delicacies, and the host must fight for control when the two teachers go head-to-head and when Simon makes sexist jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Sheffield sees musician Ivor's turn to host, and he is determined to make it a fun evening with a menu inspired by 1980s pop and a performance by his new romantic band.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former chef Simon hosts the final meal in Sheffield, but is unlikely to get an easy ride from his guests following all the criticism he has dished out at the earlier soirees. He also has to contend with the feud that's brewing between Claire and Helen, and when things boil over between the women, Monika doesn't know where to hide.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Cameras follow Chester Zoo's four new fledgling Humboldt penguins who are being brought up apart from the main colony until they're old enough to compete for fish in the main pool. They're keen to make a break for it and join the adults, but when they're finally free to go they have other ideas. Elsewhere, Niall the chimpanzee keeper has known chimp Boris for 44 years. When the ape captures a moorhen chick, Niall must use his powers of persuasion to negotiate the safe release of his hostage.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Craggy Island's most famous religious relic is due to be upgraded and Ted sets about trying to ensure the ceremony runs smoothly. However, Dougal and Jack put his plans in jeopardy when they meet the three priests in charge of proceedings. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Dougal allows himself to be led astray by rebellious new arrival Father Damien, and Ted is suspected of being the criminal mastermind behind a scandalous theft. Comedy, with Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon and Joe Rooney.(n)

programme.title: Parenting for Idiots
programme.desc: Light-hearted documentary in which a cast of famous faces reveal the many sides of modern parenting in a succession of magic moments and horror stories, while child-free celebrities experience the realities of looking after a child for the first time. Episode one focuses on the different types of chaos that ensue from having children, with Sally Phillips discussing living with nits, Frankie Boyle revealing how his children embarrass him, and Andrew Flintoff divulging a few truths about the Tooth Fairy. Plus, non-parents Jamie Laing and Mark-Francis Vandelli get a taste of parenthood by looking after a five-month-old baby for the day.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age
programme.desc: Oscar-nominated animated comedy adventure about a group of prehistoric animals who brave the elements to return a human baby to its father. Sid, a goofy and talkative sloth, wakes up to find that everyone's started to migrate south to avoid the onset of the Ice Age. Afraid of being deserted, he tags along with Manfred, an embittered mammoth who's decided he'd rather head north. After stumbling across a human camp that's under attack by a pride of sabre-toothed tigers and narrowly saving a baby, they're joined by Diego, a sabretooth who convinces them he can help return the child by tracking the humans. However, he's actually a member of the same pride - and is plotting to guide them into an ambush. Can Manny and Sid find the baby's father and avoid the frozen weather? Or will Diego's plan mean they never make it? Also featuring the voice of Jack Black(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: High Anxiety. Michelle tells Danny that she's not a baby anymore(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Rachel's Phone Number
programme.desc: The One with Rachel's Phone Number. Joey fears that Monica has a new man after Chandler sneaks home to see his wife; Ross tries---and fails---to bond with Mike (Paul Rudd), while Rachel gives out her number a little too hastily during a night out with Phoebe. Kevin: Alan F. Smith. Bartender: Kevin Brief. Crazy Cat Lady: Irene White(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Rachel Goes Back to Work
programme.desc: The One Where Rachel Goes Back to Work. In the first of three Friends appearances, Dermot Mulroney guest stars as Gavin, the Ralph Lauren employee who's been covering for Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) during her maternity leave. Showing up at the office with baby Emma in tow, Rachel immediately gets the impression that Gavin is jockeying for her job on a permanent basis -- which may explain why, a few days later, she's back at work, watching her back all the while. Meanwhile, Joey (Matt LeBlanc) wishes he'd never invited Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) to appear as an extra on Days of Our Lives(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with Phoebe's Rats. Gavin gives Rachel a very interesting birthday gift; Ross begs Joey to stay away from Emma's hot new nanny; Mike meets---and then murders---Phoebe's unusual pet(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Blind Dates
programme.desc: The One with the Blind Dates. Jon Lovitz makes a return appearance as Steve, the dopey doper whose restaurant Monica (Courteney Cox) auditioned to be a chef for during season one of Friends. Steve turns out to be one of several "candidates" that Joey (Matt LeBlanc) and Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) have chosen as potential sight-unseen dates for Ross (David Schwimmer) and Rachel (Jennifer Aniston). The logic behind this is sublime: by demonstrating how many bad choices there are in the world, Joey and Pheebs hope to bring Ross and Rachel back together(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.title: The Coroner
programme.sub-title: That's the Way to Do It.
programme.desc: After the new mayor, Una Drake, launches an initiative to clean up the town of Lighthaven, she forcibly closes the Punch and Judy stall. Later, the man behind the stall is found dead on the beach, and when Jane meets with Una, she finds her rude and abrupt. However, in the small hours, Davey and Jane are called to the scene of a second death - the mayor has been found beaten in a hotel room. The pair search for a link between the two deaths, and Jane's quest for the truth puts her life in danger. Crime drama, starring Claire Goose.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Kris Marshall is back as the British detective working on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, where the sun shines all day and it seems half the residents are killers-in-waiting. And so it appears with the first case when a plantation owner ends up dead during a seance - although with the door firmly closed at the time and all the participants holding hands round the table, who did the deed? The victim's family are convinced it was the work of a ghost said to haunt the plantation, but Humphrey is determined to find a more rational explanation. Meanwhile, Fidel has moved on, leaving Officer Dwayne Myers holding the fort - and while he is struggling to cope, the last thing he needs is the Commissioner stepping in to help. Crime drama, with guest appearances from Holby City's Don Gilet and former Corrie bad girl Natalie Gumede.(n)

programme.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
programme.desc: The first of three programmes in which cameras explore some of the most inhospitable places on the planet and the people who live there, including a team of Sherpa roping a route on Mount Everest's notorious Khumbu Icefall and, on the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro, farmers fight pitched battles to save their crops from marauding elephants. In the Amazon rainforest, two boys undergo a rite of passage involving hundreds of ants with the most painful stings on Earth, and conservationists in the Grand Canyon try to ensure the survival of one of America's few surviving condor chicks.(n)

programme.title: Sinkholes: Buried Alive
programme.desc: An investigation into sinkholes, a natural phenomenon that sees the ground give away as a result of weak acid attacking the rocks below, riddling them with holes like Swiss cheese. They can occur gradually, when the surface subsides into bowl-shaped depressions, or suddenly, when the ground gives away - swallowing animals, buildings and even entire highways. This documentary features video footage of dramatic collapses and follows scientists as they explore the underlying forces behind these natural disasters.(n)

programme.title: The Winslow Boy

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. He begins with the chaos caused by snow and ice, using real-life studies - such as Montreal being shut down by a fierce ice storm in 1998 - and sharing incredible stories of survival. He then subjects a specially built test house to an avalanche, one of the world's deadliest natural forces.(n)

programme.title: Storm City

programme.title: Storm City

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets

programme.title: Dinosaur 13
programme.desc: In 1990, paleontologist Peter Larson and his team from the Black Hills Institute made one of history's greatest dinosaur discoveries; the largest and most complete Tyrannosaurus Rex fossil ever found. The documentary details the true story behind the discovery, as well as the struggle that surrounded it, including a 10-year battle with the US government, museums, Native American tribes and competing paleontologists.(n)

programme.title: House

programme.title: House

programme.title: Back to the Future Part III
programme.desc: Time-travelling teenager Marty McFly is transported back to the days of the Wild West, where he strives to save his eccentric scientist friend Doc Brown from death at the hands of a villainous gunslinger. Final instalment in the sci-fi comedy trilogy, starring Michael J Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Mary Steenburgen and Thomas F Wilson.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson.(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence (Extended Version) (2016)
programme.desc: Premiere. Years after being humiliated as a student, rogue CIA agent Robbie Wheirdicht turns to old classmate Calvin Joyner for help when he's targeted by his own organisation. Extended version of the action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart and Amy Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Barbershop: A Fresh Cut
programme.desc: As their surrounding community has taken a turn for the worse, the crew at Calvin's Barbershop come together to bring some much-needed change to their neighbourhood. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Cedric the Entertainer and Regina Hall.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson.(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence (Extended Version) (2016)
programme.desc: Premiere. Years after being humiliated as a student, rogue CIA agent Robbie Wheirdicht turns to old classmate Calvin Joyner for help when he's targeted by his own organisation. Extended version of the action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart and Amy Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Barbershop: A Fresh Cut
programme.desc: As their surrounding community has taken a turn for the worse, the crew at Calvin's Barbershop come together to bring some much-needed change to their neighbourhood. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Cedric the Entertainer and Regina Hall.(n)

programme.title: Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan
programme.desc: A Kazakhstani journalist is sent to the United States to learn about the country and its customs. However, when the inquisitive reporter stumbles across an episode of Baywatch featuring Pamela Anderson, he becomes convinced she is his future bride and embarks on a reckless mission to track her down. Spoof documentary, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Ken Davitian and Pamela Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Gremlins
programme.desc: A teenager is given a strange, cute creature as a Christmas present by his eccentric father and warned to keep it away from water, not to feed it after midnight, or expose it to direct light. However, a chance dousing causes the furball to spawn a horde of murderous little monsters, and their devilish antics bring mayhem to a small town. Comedy horror, with Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton and Polly Holliday.(n)

programme.title: Death at a Funeral
programme.desc: A family gather to bury the patriarch, but any dignity to the occasion soon disappears in a run of disasters. The deceased's oldest son resents the success of his younger brother, while their sister's boyfriend has accidentally taken LSD and an unexpected guest has a few shock revelations to make. Comedy, with Chris Rock, Martin Lawrence, Zoe Saldana and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Bumbling Inspector Clouseau's adventures seem to have come to an end when he is mistakenly declared dead. However, the disaster-prone detective is in fact alive and well, and takes advantage of the situation to launch an undercover investigation into his own murder, adopting a variety of cunning disguises. Comedy sequel, starring Peter Sellers, Herbert Lom, Burt Kwouk and Dyan Cannon.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: The cast of a cancelled sci-fi series are reduced to a life of conventions and public appearances, only to find themselves genuinely transported into space. Naive aliens have mistaken the show for real life and want the actors to help defend them from an evil extraterrestrial warlord. Sci-fi comedy, starring Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman and Sam Rockwell.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy
programme.desc: An American police college lowers its entrance requirements in the hope of attracting new recruits, and in response, assorted dubious candidates turn up for enrolment. A short-tempered instructor is determined to weed out the bad apples, but a riot provides the clueless cops with a chance to prove their worth. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey.(n)

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: A London man's misfortunes in love look set to change when he meets an American beauty. However, the prospect of a transatlantic relationship succeeding seems slim, so the pair go their separate ways - only for him to realise he is unable to get her out of his mind. Richard Curtis's comedy, with Hugh Grant, Andie MacDowell, John Hannah, Charlotte Coleman, Kristin Scott Thomas, Simon Callow and James Fleet.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Disgraced entrepreneur Michelle Darnell attempts to launch a comeback with the reluctant help of Claire Rawlings, her former PA. Comedy, starring Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: After accidentally knocking Kate Moss into the Thames, hapless champagne-swigging friends Patsy and Edina are hounded by the paparazzi. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: Homer unwittingly pollutes Lake Springfield, so the US government decides to isolate the city underneath a giant dome. The Simpsons manage to escape and plan to start a new life in Alaska - but learn Springfield is about to be destroyed, and return to save their friends. With the voices of Dan Castellaneta, Julie Kavner, Nancy Cartwright and Yeardley Smith.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: A male nurse delays proposing to his girlfriend until he has won the approval of her strict father, a former CIA agent who does not suffer fools gladly, and vows to be on his best behaviour during a visit to her family home. However, his efforts to impress soon collapse into a catalogue of disasters. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller, Teri Polo, Blythe Danner and Owen Wilson.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Disgraced entrepreneur Michelle Darnell attempts to launch a comeback with the reluctant help of Claire Rawlings, her former PA. Comedy, starring Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: After accidentally knocking Kate Moss into the Thames, hapless champagne-swigging friends Patsy and Edina are hounded by the paparazzi. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.(n)

programme.title: Grimsby
programme.desc: Two brothers are separated at birth, the younger growing up to be MI6's top agent while the older becomes a layabout football hooligan. When they are finally reunited, the dim-witted elder sibling ends up helping his brother foil an evil plan that threatens the entire world. Action comedy, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Mark Strong and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch
programme.desc: A manic, mischievous alien escapes from the galactic police and crash-lands his spaceship on Hawaii. A lonely little girl mistakes the stranded creature for a dog and adopts him - but alien and Earth authorities are soon combing the island in search of him. Disney animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Daveigh Chase, Chris Sanders, Tia Carrere, Ving Rhames and David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: La Luna
programme.desc: Animated short film from Pixar in which a boy takes a trip to the moon with his father and grandfather.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: The Watcher in the Woods
programme.desc: Two sisters are haunted by a ghost when they and their American family move into an old mansion set deep in an English forest. As the spirit makes more and more contact with them, the girls come to realise that the spirit is the ghost of the owner's child who went missing long ago. Thriller, starring Bette Davis, Carroll Baker, David McCallum and Lynn-Holly Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Underdog
programme.desc: A mad scientist kidnaps a beagle to use as a guinea pig in his deranged experiments. But an accidental injection leaves the mutt with awe-inspiring superpowers, which he uses to foil the deranged inventor's plans to take over a city. Comedy adventure, starring Peter Dinklage and James Belushi, and featuring the voices of Jason Lee and Amy Adams.(n)

programme.title: Jungle 2 Jungle
programme.desc: A businessman ventures deep into the Amazon to look for his estranged doctor wife seeking a divorce, only to discover he has a 13-year-old son who has been raised as part of a jungle tribe. The boy is sent back to New York with his father, but has a lot to learn about the modern world. Comedy, starring Tim Allen, Lolita Davidovich, Martin Short, JoBeth Williams and Sam Huntington.(n)

programme.title: Now You See Him, Now You Don't
programme.desc: A science student creates an invisibility spray, an invention that could help save his college from financial ruin - but it soon attracts the attention of a gang of scheming crooks wanting to use it for more dishonest ends. Disney adventure, sequel to The Computer Wore Tennis Shoes, starring Kurt Russell, Cesar Romero, Joe Flynn and Jim Backus.(n)

programme.title: Pooh's Grand Adventure: The Search for Christopher Robin
programme.desc: Christopher Robin starts school and leaves a note for Winnie the Pooh explaining why he will not be around any more. However, the bear misunderstands the message and becomes convinced his friend is in grave danger, organising the other animals into a rescue attempt. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jim Cummings and John Fiedler.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Tangled
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: An intrepid treasure-hunter follows a series of ingenious clues in a perilous quest to track down a war chest hidden by America's founding fathers generations before. He has to contend with determined rivals in the shape of a treacherous associate and the FBI. Action adventure, starring Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Sean Bean and Justin Bartha.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Tangled

When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight.
